meanings.definition: A reason or explanation offered to justify or defend a fault or offense.
meanings.sent1: She gave an excuse for being late to school.
meanings.sent2: His excuse for not finishing the project was that he ran out of time.
meanings.sent3: The dog's excuse for eating the homework was that it looked like a tasty snack.
meanings.sent4: Her excuse for missing the meeting was as thin as a sheet of paper.
meanings.sent5: The excuse he made up was like a shield protecting him from getting in trouble.

meanings.definition: To forgive or overlook a fault or offense.
meanings.sent1: I will excuse your mistake this time.
meanings.sent2: She decided to excuse his behavior because she understood his situation.
meanings.sent3: He excused her lateness by saying traffic was unusually bad.
meanings.sent4: Excusing his actions felt like lifting a heavy weight off her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: Excusing his behavior was like giving him a free pass to do it again.

meanings.definition: To release from an obligation or duty.
meanings.sent1: The teacher excused him from the assignment due to his illness.
meanings.sent2: She excused herself from the meeting to take an important call.
meanings.sent3: He excused his friend from helping with the move because of a prior commitment.
meanings.sent4: Excusing him from the task was like removing a heavy burden from his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The boss excused her from the presentation, allowing her to focus on other tasks.
